intro: Tetrastigma canarense, commonly known as the Canary vine, is a climbing plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its tendrils that help it climb and spread across vegetation. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are edible. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often have a reddish hue. Tetrastigma canarense thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of the Canary Islands.
